p: Jethva et al. carried out the anti-mycobacterial activity of the aqueous extract of C. hirsutus against Mycobacterium tuberculosis H 37Rv and the extract showed potent anti-mycobacterial activity with the inhibition percentage of 80.26% [ 49]. Gupta et al. evaluated the anti-mycobacterial activity of ethanol extract of the leaves of C. hirsutus against M. tuberculosis H 37Rv and various multidrug resistant (MDR) strains. The extract showed potent anti-mycobacterial activity against M. tuberculosis H37Rv and MDR strains JAl-19187, JAL-19126, JAL 19049, JAL 19111 and JAL- 19188 with MIC values of 500, 250, 500, 250, 500 and 500 Âµg/mL, respectively [ 50].
